dct_title_s: Military sketch of part of British Kaffraria
dct_description_sm: This sketch is based on two lines measured by chains from Ft. Glamorgan to the point just above Ebb & Flow drift on the Buffalo River and on the ridge above Igoda River through Fort Grey towards the Buffalo River, all the bearings having been taken by Schmalcalder's compass. The points plotted with greater accuracy than could have been expected with such means and several of these points are marked thus. They would be readily identified by any one wishing to continue this map. The Keiskamma River and the Coast from that River to the Goolah is laid down from old maps.
dct_rights_sm: Image courtesy University of Cape Town Libraries, Special Collections: Maps scanned under the William and Yvonne Jacobson Digital Africana Program at UCT. If you have questions, please contact David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
